Title: Productivity's Battleground (Forbes.com)
Description: Forbes.com - At its Twinsburg, Ohio plant (below), Rockwell uses its own Logix controllers to make the 2.5 million circuit boards per year that power them. On one line, sensors scan boards as they move along a conveyor; if a match is found, a controller inches the conveyor forward. The same controller tracks the temperature of an oven used to cure the glue between the electronics and the board, adjusting the speed of the oven's conveyor based on the reading. All the controllers are lashed to an enterprise-management program that spits out productivity readings every two hours and looks for bottlenecks. ...

This standard has been in the works for years.

According to CBS news, the analyst had ties  #8220;to Rumsfeld's deputy Paul Wolfowitz and Defense Undersecretary Douglas Feith, both regarded as leading architects of the war on Iraq. #8221; However, another government official claims the suspect is "not in a level to influence policy."

Title: Swiss Army Medicine (Forbes.com)
Description: Forbes.com - Early last year 61-year-old Judy Norris was ready to stop all treatment and let her cancer run its course. Her kidney tumor, diagnosed in 1997, had spread to her abdomen, pancreas and both lungs. Six months of treatment with toxic interleukin-2, one of the only treatments for advanced kidney cancer, had eroded nerves in her hands and feet, caused frequent vomiting and made her skin peel all over--but did nothing to slow the tumors' relentless growth. Title: No problem is found after bomb alert on jet
Description: LONDON A police search found no threat to a Greek airliner that was forced to make an emergency landing in Britain after a bomb alert, officers said Monday.

Title: Removing Fannie and Freddie government perks
Description: Mortgage giants Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae receive special government perks that yield few benefits for society at large, but create significant potential social costs, according to a new report by the Cato Institute.

Title: Rossi takes provisional pole at Phillip Island
Description: Italian Valentino Rossi, chasing a fourth consecutive premier race world title, has grabbed provisional pole after initial qualifying in the Australian MotoGP at Phillip Island in Victoria.

Title: FBI Investigates UC Berkeley Computer Hack Case
Description: The FBI is trying to find whoever hacked into a computer at the University of California at Berkeley. The computer contained personal information -- including social security numbers -- of nearly 1.5 million

Title: UN deadline on Darfur approaches
Description: A deadline for Sudan's government to improve security in troubled Darfur is set to expire later on Monday.

Title: Police Raid Mexico City Neighborhood
Description: Nearly 1,000 police and federal agents tore through a town outside Mexico City, smashing gates and breaking down doors in a hunt for the leaders of a vigilante mob that burned two federal agents to death.

Title: Smart Phone Market Growing Rapidly
Description: The smart phone market will grow more crowded Wednesday with the debut of two devices directed at opposite ends of the customer spectrum: a BlackBerry for consumers with a newfangled keyboard and a Nokia phone-organizer for mobile business professionals.

Title: Sparks 71, Monarchs 57
Description: Mwadi Mabika scored 22 points and Tamecka Dixon had 17 points, nine rebounds and five assists to lead the Los Angeles Sparks to a 71-57 victory over the Sacramento Monarchs in the second game of their WNBA first-round playoff series Sunday.

Title: Lukas, Baffert, Frankel, Bailey must mean it #39;s Breeders #39; Cup
Description: If D. Wayne Lukas, Bob Baffert, Bobby Frankel, Jerry Bailey and Pat Day are at the same track on the same day, it must be the Breeders #39; Cup.

Title: No. 7 Louisville Tops Cincinnati, 70-7 (AP)
Description: AP - Montrell Jones caught two touchdown passes and returned a punt for a score, and No. 7 Louisville clinched its third Conference USA championship since 2000 with a 70-7 rout of Cincinnati on Saturday.

Title: Google Buys Digital Mapping Company
Description: Google Inc. has bought digital map maker Keyhole Corp., extending the search engine leader #39;s bid to fend off rivals with a toolbox that can catalog almost anything in the world.

Title: Symbol, Proxim settle WLAN patent case
Description: Symbol Technologies and Proxim Corporation said Tuesday (Sept. 14) that they have settled a patent infringement case focusing on wireless LAN (WLAN)technology.

Title: Royal  amp; Sun moves 1,100 jobs to India
Description: Royal  amp; Sun Alliance, the UK #39;s second biggest insurer, today incurred the wrath of unions by announcing plans to move more than 1,000 jobs to India.

Title: Hungary Wins Gold in Olympic Water Polo

Title: UN adopts resolution on Sudan, slammed by aid agencies as 'weak' (AFP)
Description: AFP - The Khartoum government and rebels pledged to sign a final accord ending a two-decade war in southern Sudan by the end of the year, as the UN Security Council unanimously adopted a resolution pushing for peace in the war-ravaged country.

Title: ASEAN sign free trade agreement
Description: The Association of Southeast Asian nations (ASEAN) and China have signed an agreement to create the world #39;s biggest free trade area by removing tariffs for their two billion people by the end of the decade.

Title: Fears grow for Falluja civilians
Description: Iraqis trapped in the besieged rebel city of Falluja face a humanitarian disaster, aid agencies warn.

Title: Hopes for Solution to Afghan Hostage Crisis
Description: KABUL (Reuters) - Three U.N. workers held by militants in  Afghanistan were in their third week of captivity on Friday  after calls from both sides for the crisis to be resolved ahead  of this weekend's Muslim festival of Eid al-Fitr.

Title: U.S. Troops Clash with Shi'ite Militia in Najaf (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - U.S. troops clashed with Shi'ite\militiamen in Najaf on Saturday, interrupting a day of relative\calm in the holy city with the sound of mortar,\rocket-propelled grenade and machinegun fire, witnesses said.

Title: Newman wins pole in Martinsville
Description: MARTINSVILLE, Virginia (Ticker) - Ryan Newman is probably too far back in the  quot;Chase for the Championship quot; to seriously contend for the title.

Title: Greek Plane Diverted to Ireland After Bomb Threat
Description: DUBLIN (Reuters) - A Greek plane heading for New York from  Athens made an emergency landing in Ireland on Tuesday after a  bomb alert -- the second such incident in three days.

Title: Situation in Darfur region still troublesome: UN official
Description: A senior United Nations official said here Monday that the situation in the western Sudanese regionof Darfur is still troublesome.

Title: Liverpool bank on Gerrard to provide winning return
Description: THE previous time that Steven Gerrard was in Monaco, it was three years ago as the tyro at the heart of a Liverpool team contesting the European Super Cup final, which would yield his fifth winners medal in a heady six-month period.

Title: Singh Spoils 100th Anniversary Party in Canada
Description: OAKVILLE, Ontario (Reuters) - Vijay Singh began his reign  as world number one with a dramatic sudden death playoff win  over Mike Weir in the Canadian Open on Sunday.

Description: LONDON, August 24 (New Ratings) - The Spanish banking giant, Banco Santander Central Hispano (BSD2.FSE), has expressed its commitment to its 8.

Title: High court to hear wine case
Description: Juanita Swedenburg first planted grapes 24 years ago to help pay the taxes on her 130-acre Valley View Farm near Middleburg in the heart of Virginia #39;s hunt country.

Title: Nigeria announces fuel price cuts
Description: Nigeria's government cuts the price of fuel in a bid to avert a planned general strike by the country's biggest unions.

Title: Oil Hits \$44 as U.S. Crude Stocks Slide
Description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Oil prices soared to \$44 a barrel on  Wednesday, ending a streak of heavy losses, as a U.S.  government report showed crude oil stocks falling to the lowest  level in five months.

Title: US families suffer from web withdraw
Description: The study, which was conducted by Yahoo and media agency OMD, examined the way in which 13 US households reacted to being denied access to the internet for two weeks.

Title: Eyeing Iran Reactors, Israel Seeks U.S. Bunker Bombs (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - The United States plans to sell\Israel  #36;319 million worth of air-launched bombs, including 500\"bunker busters" able to penetrate Iran's underground nuclear\facilities, Israeli security sources said on Tuesday.

Title: Gates undaunted by Linux
Description: Speaking to technologists during an appearance at the Computer History Museum, Microsoft Chairman and Chief Software Architect Bill Gates touched on a number of topics, including Linux, Web services, grid computing and digital rights management.

Title: Yanks Walk Over O's
Description: Gary Sheffield and Hideki Matsui hit consecutive homers in the ninth inning, and the Yankees take advantage of 14 walks in a 9-7 win over the Orioles on Sunday.

Title: Oil Prices Rise Toward \$52 a Barrel, Set Another Record High
Description: Oil prices hit record highs again Wednesday, amid continuing concerns about the supply of crude oil. In New York, crude oil for future delivery hit an all-time high of \$51.

Title: Retail sales fall more than expected

Title: Will This Takeover Plan Turn Into Gold? (The Motley Fool)
Description: The Motley Fool - Here's something you don't see every day -- the continuing brouhaha between Oracle (Nasdaq: ORCL - News) and PeopleSoft (Nasdaq: PSFT - News) being a notable exception. South Africa's Harmony Gold Mining Company (NYSE: HMY - News) has announced a hostile takeover bid to acquire fellow South African miner Gold Fields Limited (NYSE: GFI - News). The transaction, if it takes place, would be an all-stock acquisition, with Harmony issuing 1.275 new shares in payment for each share of Gold Fields. The deal would value Gold Fields at more than  #36;8 billion. ...

Title: Delta to Cut Wages 10 Percent

Title: Verizon Third-Quarter Profit Flat (AP)
Description: AP - Verizon Communications Inc.'s third-quarter profit held steady at about  #36;1.80 billion as declining revenues from traditional phone services at the nation's biggest telephone company were offset by another blockbuster quarter for Verizon Wireless, which added a record 1.7 million subscribers.

Title: U.S. Intensifies Assault on Fallujah

Title: Sri Lanka: LTTE leader impatient with the government

Title: AOL Rings Up New Shopping Service
Description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - America Online, the world's largest  Internet service provider on Monday launched an overhauled  online shopping center it hopes will help it keep pace with  competitive offerings by Yahoo Inc.<A HREF="http://www.reuters.co.uk/financeQuoteLookup.jhtml?ticker=YHOO.O qtype=sym infotype=info qcat=news">YHOO.O</A>, Google Inc.  <A HREF="http://www.reuters.co.uk/financeQuoteLookup.jhtml?ticker=GOOG.O qtype=sym infotype=info qcat=news">GOOG.O</A> and Shopping.com, executives said.

Description: The founder of Peru's Maoist Shining Path insurgency raised a defiant fist and proclaimed "glory to Marxism" in court Friday as the government retried him on terrorism charges a decade after he was sentenced to life in prison.

Description: A battle group of British troops began to roll out of southern Iraq Wednesday on a US-requested mission to deadlier areas near Baghdad in a major political gamble for British Prime Minister Tony Blair.

Title: Group to Propose New High-Speed Wireless Format
Description: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - A group of technology companies  including Texas Instruments Inc. <A HREF="http://www.reuters.co.uk/financeQuoteLookup.jhtml?ticker=TXN.N qtype=sym infotype=info qcat=news">TXN.N</A>, STMicroelectronics  <A HREF="http://www.reuters.co.uk/financeQuoteLookup.jhtml?ticker=STM.PA qtype=sym infotype=info qcat=news">STM.PA</A> and Broadcom Corp. <A HREF="http://www.reuters.co.uk/financeQuoteLookup.jhtml?ticker=BRCM.O qtype=sym infotype=info qcat=news">BRCM.O</A>, on Thursday said they  will propose a new wireless networking standard up to 10 times  the speed of the current generation.

Title: British energy expert alerts Ont. to failures in hydro restructuring (Canadian Press)
Description: Canadian Press - WINDSOR, Ont. (CP) - Ontario risks sharp price increases if it gives the private sector a greater role in the electricity market, says a British expert on energy markets.

Title: Arsenal extends record unbeaten run
Description: Arsenal extended its record league unbeaten streak to 44 games with a 4-1 victory Saturday at Norwich, and 18-year-old American defender Jonathan Spector made his Premier

Title: Governor keeps dirty video games away from minors
Description: Gov. Rod Blagojevich has taken an aggressive stand on exposure of Illinoiss minors to violent and sexually explicit video games, by proposing a ban on the sale of the video games.

Title: Marion Barry Victorious in Comeback Bid (AP)
Description: AP - Former Washington Mayor Marion Barry, infamous for being caught smoking crack on an FBI videotape, has made it back to city hall  #151; again.

Description: Debbie and Frank Vana Sr. have followed their son over countless fairways in numerous tournaments, but yesterday was something  quot;very special. quot;

Title: Kennedy Cousin Fighting Assault Accusation
Description: CHICAGO - William Kennedy Smith said Monday he has resigned from the humanitarian group he founded while he fights sexual assault allegations leveled by a former employee.   "I am simply doing everything I can to protect the organization I love," Smith said in his first public appearance since Audra Soulias filed a lawsuit last week alleging he sexually assaulted her five years ago...

Title: Myanmar military ruler says democracy only option (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - Myanmar military ruler Senior General Than Shwe told Indian leaders on Monday the junta was committed to bringing democracy, a week after ousting a fellow general credited with setting in motion a roadmap for change.

Title: Torch goes out
Description: The Olympics closed with praise for the athletes and relief that the event was safe from terrorism. BY RICK MAESE / ORLANDO SENTINEL.

Title: Gateway spices up new notebooks
Description: The computer maker unveils four new laptops, with an eye on the upcoming holiday season.

Title: US Air, Pilots Union in Tentative Pact
Description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - US Airways Group Inc. <A HREF="http://www.investor.reuters.com/FullQuote.aspx?ticker=UAIRQ.PK target=/stocks/quickinfo/fullquote">UAIRQ.PK</A> said  on Friday it reached a tentative agreement with its pilots  union that would save \$300 million annually and move the  bankrupt airline closer to carrying out a transformation plan.

Title: Key Part of Patriot Act Ruled Unconstitutional
Description: A federal judge in New York ruled that a key component of the USA Patriot Act is unconstitutional because it allows the FBI to demand information from Internet service providers without judicial oversight or public review.

Title: Powell Says UN Is Doing Enough for Iraq Elections (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - Secretary of State Colin Powell said\on Thursday that U.N. plans to help with the upcoming election\in Iraq appeared to be on track, despite months of pressure for\the world body to increase its staff.

Title: Just Keep It Peaceful, Protesters; New York Is Offering Discounts
Description: In a bid to keep protesters from disrupting the Republican National Convention, the Bloomberg administration is offering "peaceful political activists" discounts.

Title: Four dead in Argentine high school rampage
Description: A high school student wielding a 9mm pistol shot and killed four classmates and wounded five more today in Argentina #39;s worst school rampage, police said.

Title: #39;Flores man not a new species #39;
Description: Jakarta - A leading Indonesian scientist on Saturday challenged the widely publicised theory that fossilised bones found on the eastern island of Flores were from a previously unknown species of human.

Title: Rainy-day plan for Fenway ticket-holders
Description: With forecasters predicting heavy rain, the Red Sox said tonight's game would be made up Monday if it can't be played tonight. Title: IBM Plans Web Meeting Service, Takes Aim at WebEx (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - IBM  plans to offer\Web-conferencing as a hosted Internet service, seeking to reach\small and medium-sized business customers while taking on more\established rivals in the market, the company said on Tuesday.

Title: US Treasuries Up, Long-End Leads the Way
Description: LONDON (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury prices crept higher on  Wednesday, with long-dated bonds benefiting from the view that  higher U.S. interest rates will help keep inflation under  control.

Title: One more to gold
Description: HERAKLION, Greece - Heather O #39;Reilly had posters of Mia Hamm on her New Jersey bedroom wall for years and years and years and years.

Title: Bertuzzi Enters Plea
Description: Vancouver Canucks winger Todd Bertuzzi pleaded not guilty on Thursday to an on-ice assault charge stemming from a hit on Colorado Avalanche's Steve Moore that broke his neck.
